docs.title: Cookbook
docs.text:
Each recipe is a markdown file with three sections:

  1. Ingredients as shopping list with sections for:
    • Produce
    • Dairy
    • Middle
    • Staples - Check pantry
  2. Ingredients as a prep list
  3. Cooking instructions
  4. Notes (e.g., prep time)
  5. Citation
  • Cookbook
    • Links - Solid
      • Entrees
      • Sides
      • Desserts
    • Links - Want Try

docs.title: Shopping
docs.text:
• Produce
    • 1.5lbs beets (3-5, 1.5lbs)
    • arugula (5oz, 5c)
    • radishes (4, medium)
    • green onion (.33c)
  • Dairy
    • goat cheese (4oz)
  • Middle
    • pistachios (.33c, shelled/salted/toasted) or pepitas (.5c)
  • Staples
    • olive oil (.33c)
    • red wine vinegar (2tbsp)
    • honey (1tbsp)
    • Dijon mustard (1tbsp)
    • salt (.5tsp)
    • pepper

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
1. Scrub beets, slice off ends, slice into wedges
  2. Thinly slice radishes.
  3. Chop green onion
  4. Big bowl:
    • arugula (5oz, 5c)
    • pistachios (.33c) or pepitas (.5c)
    • goat cheese (4oz) crumbled
    • green onion (.33c)
  5. Whisk dressing
    • olive oil (.25c)
    • red wine vinegar (2tbsp)
    • honey (1tbsp)
    • Dijon mustard (1tbsp)
    • salt (.5tsp)
    • pepper

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
1. Oven to 375
  2. Beets to baking sheet, toss with oil and salt, roast 35-40m
  3. Add beets to salad
  4. Toss with dressing

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Suggested Time: 60m
    • Prep: 20m
    • Cook: 40m
  • Servings: 4-6

docs.title: Citation
docs.text: Inspired by: Cookie and Kate

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• Produce
    • Onion (2)
    • Mushrooms
    • Garlic cloves (2)
    • Cilantro (1/4 c)
  • Middle
    • Black beans (30 oz)
    • Hamburger buns
  • Dairy
    • Eggs (2)
    • Pepper jack cheese slices
  • Staples
    • Pickles
    • Ketchup (2 tbsp)
    • Worcestershire sauce (2 tsp)
    • Hot sauce (1/2 tsp)
    • BBQ sauce (2 tbsp)
    • Salt (3/4 tsp)
    • Black pepper (1/2 tsp)
    • Cumin (1 tsp)
    • Chili powder (1 tsp)
    • Smoked paprika (1 tsp)
    • Breadcrumbs (1/2 c)
    • Olive oil (1 tbsp)

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
1. Drain and rinse black beans.
  2. Carmelize 1 onion
  3. Prep pan fry mushrooms
  4. Aromatics
    • Finely chop 1 onion
    • Press 2 garlic cloves
  5. Bowl, mix
    • 2 eggs
    • 2 tbsp ketchup
    • 2 tsp Worcestershire sauce
    • 1/2 tsp hot sauce
    • 2 tbsp BBQ sauce
    • 3/4 tsp salt
    • 1/2 tsp black pepper
    • 1 tsp cumin
    • 1 tsp chili powder
    • 1 tsp smoked paprika
    • 1/2 c breadcrumbs

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Preheat oven to 325
  2. Spread beans on sheet, bake 15m to dry
  3. For onion, garlic
    1. Pan fry until softened, 5-6m.
    2. Blot dry
    3. Add to bowl
  4. Form the into 6 patties.
  5. Oven to 400
  6. Bake for 10 minutes on each side.
  7. Add Cheese, continue bake
  8. Serve

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Suggested Time: 45m
    • Prep: 30m
    • Cook: 15m
  • Servings: 6

docs.title: Citation
docs.text: Inspried by Sally's Baking Addiction.

docs.title: Shopping
docs.text:
• Produce
    • yellow onions (2)
    • garlic (6)
    • broccoli with stalks (2lbs, 3-4)
    • large russet potato (12oz, 1)
    • green onions (opt)
  • Dairy
    • cheddar sharp (4-8oz)
  • Middle (none)
  • Staples
    • butter unsalted (3tbsp)
    • red pepper flakes (.5tsp)
    • sea salt (1.25tsp)
    • black pepper
    • water (6c)

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
• Bowl: aromatics and spices
    • Onion (2): coarse chop
    • Garlic (6): press
    • red pepper flakes (.5tsp)
    • sea salt (1.25tsp)
    • black pepper (10 twists)
  • Broc
    • Slice off florettes, dice up
    • Chop off stalks, peel, cut 1in pieces
  • Measure 6c water + 1tsp salt
  • Potato (1): Cut 1in chunks
  • Cheddar (4-8oz): Grate
  • Slice green onion

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
1. Soup pot, med-low heat. Melt butter
  2. Add aromatics and spices
  3. Cook, stir occasionally 8-10m
  4. Add
    • stalks
    • potato
    • 6c water, 1tsp salt
  5. Bring to boil, reduce med-low
  6. Cover and let simmer 20-25m
  7. Add half florets, stir, cover, cook until bright green (3-5m)
  8. Transfer to blender in batches, blend
  9. Return to pot, add rest florets, stir, cover, cook (4-7m)
  10. Add 4oz cheese
  11. Garnish with cheese and green onion

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Suggested Time: 65m
    • Prep: 15m
    • Cook: 50m
  • Servings: 6

docs.title: Citation
docs.text: Inspired by: Cookie and Kate

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• Produce
    • Broccoli (2 heads)
    • Yellow onion (1)
    • Garlic (2)
    • Fresh thyme (1 tbsp)
  • Dairy
    • Unsalted butter (6 tbsp)
    • Milk (1.5 c)
    • Cheddar cheese (8 oz)
  • Staples
    • All-purpose flour (.25 c)
    • Panko breadcrumbs (1 c)
    • Nutmeg (1/4 tsp)
    • Salt and pepper

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
1. Broccoli into bite-sized florets
  2. Finely chop 1 onion
  3. Press 2 garlic cloves
  4. Strip 1 tbsp fresh thyme.
  5. Shred 8 oz cheddar cheese.
  6. Measure
    • .25 c flour
    • 1.5 c milk
    • 1 c breadcrumbs

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Oven 400°F.
  2. Roast broccoli 20m
  3. In pan
    • melt 6 tbsp unsalted butter.
    • Whisk in 1/4 c all-purpose flour.
    • Pour in 1.5 c milk
    • bring to a simmer, stirring frequently until thickened.
  4. Off heat, add
    • Nutmeg (1/4 tsp)
    • Salt and pepper
    • .75 c cheddar cheese
    • 1.5 c milk
    • Broccoli
  5. Top with .75 c cheese, 1c breadcrumbs
  6. Reduce oven 350, Bake 25m

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Suggested Time: 30 minutes
  • Servings: 6

docs.title: Citation
docs.text: This recipe was adapted from Cookie and Kate.

docs.title: Shopping
docs.text:
• Produce
    • Brussels sprouts
  • Dairy
    • Parmesan
  • Middle
    • Panchetta
  • Staples

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
• Preheat oven to 425-450°
  • Cut bottom and halves
  • Ditch outer dirty leaves
  • Coat in olive oil and salt
  • Arrange face down

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
• Cook pancetta like pan bacon
  • Bake 425-450° 39m
  • Combine all in bowl, add parm

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Suggested Time: 50m
    • Prep: 10m
    • Cook: 40m

docs.title: Citation
docs.text: Inspired by: Aunt Chrissy

docs.title: Shopping
docs.text:
• Produce
    • cauliflower (1, 2lbs)
    • red onion (1)
    • garlic (2)
    • lemon juice (1tbsp)
    • parsley, chives and/or green onions (2tbsp, opt)
  • Dairy
    • unsalted butter (2tbsp)
  • Middle
    • vegetable broth (32oz)
  • Staples
    • salt
    • nutmeg (.25tsp)
    • extra-virgin olive oil (3tbsp)

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
1. Cauli (2lbs) into bite-size florets - to lined baking sheet
  2. Chop red onion (1)
  3. Press garlic (2)
  4. Chop garnish green (2tbsp, opt)
  5. Juice lemon (1tbsp)
  6. Set aside
    • veg broth (32oz)
    • unsalted butter (2tbsp)
    • nutmeg (.25tsp)

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
1. Oven to 425F
    1. Toss cauli with 2tbsp olive oil
    2. Bake 25-35m, tossing halfway
  2. Soup pot with olive oil (1tbsp) over medium heat
    1. Add onion (1) and salt (.25tsp)
    2. Cook stirring occasionally (5-7m)
    3. Add garlic (2), cook stirring constantly (30s)
    4. Add broth (32oz)
    5. Add cauli (minus 4 garnish florets)
    6. Increase heat to medium-high, simmer
    7. Reduce heat to maintain simmer
    8. Stirring occasionally, cook (20m)
    9. Let cool (5m)
  3. To blender
    1. Add butter (2tbsp)
    2. Blend until smooth
    3. Add lemon juice (1tbsp) and nutmeg (.25tsp)
    4. Blend again, salt/lemon juice to taste
  4. Serve with garnish

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Suggested Time: 70m
    • Prep: 15m
    • Cook: 55m
  • Servings: 4

docs.title: Citation
docs.text: Inspired by Cookie and Kate

docs.title: Shopping
docs.text:
• Produce
    • red onion (.5)
    • garlic (4)
    • brussels sprouts (1c)
    • kale (1)
  • Dairy
    • sharp cheddar (4oz)
    • plain yogurt
  • Middle
    • chickpea flour (.5c)
  • Staples
    • olive oil (4tbsp)
    • Kosher salt
    • hot sauce

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
1. Derib kale
  2. Thinly slice
    • kale (1)
    • brussels sprouts (1c)
    • red onion (.5)
  3. Press garlic (4)
  4. Grate sharp cheddar (4oz)
  5. Set aside
    • chickpea flour (.5c)
    • plain yogurt
    • hot sauce
  6. Small bowl, whisk
    • chickpea flour (.5c)
    • ½ cup plus 2 Tbsp. cold water
    • let sit 10m-1h

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
NOTE: Always spray pan first

  1. Oven to 350°
  2. Skillet, medium-high, 2 Tbsp. olive oil
    1. Add onion, garlic, brussels sprouts (3m)
    2. Add kale (3m)
    3. Add hot sauce (2tsp), salt, toss
    4. Transfer to medium bowl, wipe out skillet
  3. Skillet, medium-high, 1 tsp. olive oil
    1. Add batter (.25c), swirl to form thin 6" pancake (2m)
    2. Cook until well browned, crispy edges (2m)
    3. Flip, cook until lightly browned (1m)
    4. Transfer to rimmed baking sheet
    5. Repeat (4 total)
  4. Prep pancakes
    1. Divide vegetables between 2 pancakes
    2. Top with cheese, remaining 2 pancakes
    3. Bake until cheese is melted (6-8m)
  5. Serve topped with yogurt, hot sauce

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: • Servings: 2

docs.title: Citation
docs.text: Inspired by: Bon Appetit

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• Produce
    • Kale (8 oz)
  • Dairy
    • Sour Cream (4 tbsp)
  • Middle
    • Chicken Breast Strips (20 oz)
    • Tomato Paste (3 oz)
    • Coconut Milk (11 oz)
  • Staples
    • Basmati Rice (1 c)
    • Curry Powder (2 tbsp)
    • Paprika (2 teaspoons)
    • Chili Flakes (2 teaspoons)
    • Salt
    • Pepper
    • Vegetable Oil (2 tbsp)
    • Sugar (4 teaspoons)
    • Butter (2 tbsp)

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Cook 1c rice in a rice cooker.
  2. Kale: Wash, dry, derib.
  3. Chicken: Pat dry, season with salt and pepper.
  4. Measure Sour Cream (4 tbsp)
  5. Wet bowl:
    • Open coconut milk.
    • Sugar (4 teaspoons)
    • Butter (2 tbsp)
  6. Measure out spices.
    • Tomato Paste (3 oz)
    • Curry Powder (2 tbsp)
    • Paprika (2 teaspoons)
    • Chili Flakes (2 teaspoons)

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Large pan, med-high heat.
    1. Add kale and season with salt and pepper.
    2. Cook, stirring occasionally, until tender (5-7 min).
    3. Transfer to a plate.
  2. Same pan, med-high heat. Add chicken, til browned (4-6 min).
  3. Same pan, med heat.
    1. Add tomato paste, curry powder, paprika, spices.
    2. Cook, stirring, until chicken coated and spices are fragrant (1 min).
    3. Add coconut milk, .25 cup water, 2 teaspoons sugar, 1 tablespoon butter,
  4. Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat to low (2-3 min)
  5. Add kale and sour cream (4 tbsp); stir to combine.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Suggested Time: 25m
  • Servings: 4

docs.title: Citation
docs.text: Inspired by HelloFresh.

docs.title: Shopping
docs.text:
• Produce
    • Eggs (2)
    • Garlic (2)
    • Green onion (1)
    • Kale (1)
    • Lime (1)
    • Edamame (opt)
  • Dairy (none)
  • Middle (none)
  • Staples
    • high heat oil (2 tbsp)
    • misc chopped veg (opt)
    • sea salt
    • coconut flakes (.75 c)
    • brown rice (2 c)
    • soy sauce (2 tsp)
    • sriracha (2 tsp)

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
NOTE: Cook rice ahead of time

  1. Cook/chill 2 cups brown rice
  2. Derib and chop kale
  3. Measure 3/4 cup coconut flakes
  4. Bowl: Wisk 2 eggs, dash salt
  5. Bowl aromatics
    1. Press 2 garlic
    2. Chop 3/4 cup green onion
    3. Chop 1 cup veg (opt)
  6. Bowl sauce
    1. Soy sauce (2 tsp)
    2. Sriacha (2 tsp)
    3. Juice of 1/2 lime

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
1. Large pan
    • Med-high heat until water sizzles
    • 1 tsp oil
    • Pour in the eggs, stir frequently, scrambled and lightly set
    • Eggs to bowl
    • Wipe pan
  2. Same pan - 1 tbsp oil
    • Add galic/green onion, optional veg
    • Cook until fragrant or veg tender, stir frequently, 30s+
    • Add kale and dash salt, cook 1-2m unil tender
    • Transfer to bowl of eggs
  3. Same pan - 2 tsp oil
    • Add coconut flakes, cook until lightly golden, 30s+
    • Add rice, cook until hot, 3m
    • Pour bowl back into pan, break up eggs
    • Once warmed, remove from heat
  4. Same pan
    • Add soy, sriracha, lime juice
    • Stir to combine
    • Taste, add tamari or salt as needed
  5. Garnish with lime wedges, serve

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Suggested Time: 35m
    • Prep: 20m
    • Cook: 15m
  • Servings: 2

docs.title: Citation
docs.text: Inspired by: Cookie and Kate

docs.title: Shopping
docs.text:
• Produce
    • Tomato, roma
    • Lettuce
  • Dairy
    • Shredded cheese
    • Nacho cheese
    • Sour cream
  • Middle
    • Burrito tortillas
    • Tostada
    • Spicy veggie sausage
    • Guacamole
  • Staples
    • Hot sauce

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
1. Chop and saute sausage
  2. Chop lettuce and tomato
  3. Plug in panini press

docs.title: Cook
docs.text: 1. Assemble

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: • Suggested Time: 10m

docs.title: Citation
docs.text: Inspired by: Rainbow Plant Life

docs.title: Shopping
docs.text:
• Produce
    • eggplant (2)
    • fresh basil (.25c)
    • fresh oragano (2tbsp)
  • Dairy
    • eggs (2)
    • fresh ricotta (400g)
    • parmesan (.33c)
    • mozzarella (1c)
  • Middle
    • tomato pasta sauce (1c)
    • pine nuts (.33c, opt)
  • Staples
    • oil spray

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
Note: Original recipe says to cut eggplant into 6 slices, we go thinner.

  1. Trim eggplant, slice thin
  2. Bowl
    1. Grated Parmesan (.33c)
    2. Beatten eggs (2)
    3. Fresh ricotta (400g)
    4. Chopped basil (.25c)
    5. Chopped oragano (2tbsp)
  3. Grate Mozzarella (1c)
  4. Set out
    • tomato pasta sauce (1c)
    • pine nuts (.33c)
  5. Spray muffin pan

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
1. Oven to 410
  2. Eggplant
    1. Spray both sides with oil
    2. Fry in batches (3-4min each side)
    3. Set aside to cool (5min)
  3. Muffin pan
    1. Cut each eggplant slice in half
    2. Line pan with slices
    3. Scoop ricotta mixture into each cup
    4. Add pasta sauce, mozzarella, pine nuts
  4. Bake (20-25m)
  5. Let rest (10m)

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Suggested Time: 80m
    • Prep: 35m
    • Cook: 45m
  • Servings: 6
  • Substitutions: X

docs.title: Citation
docs.text: Inspired by: Taste

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• Produce
    • Garlic (2)
    • Lemon (1)
    • Cucumber (1)
    • Tomato, roma
    • Jalapeno
    • Green onion (2)
  • Dairy
    • Eggs (1)
    • Parmesan (0.25 c)
    • Plain yogurt (1 c)
  • Middle
    • quinoa (0.5 c)
    • chickpeas (15 oz)
    • pita
  • Staples
    • ground cumin (0.5 tsp)
    • paprika (0.5 tsp)
    • salt and pepper
    • olive oil (2 tbsp)

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
NOTE: Quinoa takes time

  1. Cook .5c quinoa
  2. Chickpeas, drain and rinse
  3. De-seed jalapeno

  4. In food processor

    • Jalapeno
    • 2 green onion

  5. 2 garlic

  6. Chickpeas

  7. 2c spinach

  8. Grate .25c parm

  9. 1 egg
  10. Spice mix
    • ground cumin (0.5 tsp)
    • paprika (0.5 tsp)
    • dash salt and pepper

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Food processor, pulse until fine chopped
    • 15oz chickpeas
    • 2c spinach
    • 2 garlic
  2. Add then pulse
    • quinoa
    • Parmesan
    • egg
    • spices
  3. Shape into 8 patties, pan fry 3-4m er side
  4. Serve with yogurt, lemon, pita, tomato, cucumber.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Suggested Time: 35m
    • Prep: 20m
    • Cook: 15m
  • Servings: 2

docs.title: Citation
docs.text: Inspried by Woman's Day.

docs.title: Shopping
docs.text:
• Produce
    • Russet potatoes (2, 1lb)
    • Onion (1, 8oz)
  • Dairy
    • Eggs (2)
  • Middle
  • Staples
    • Flour (.5)
    • salt (2tsp)
    • pepper (.5tsp)
    • baking powder (1tsp)

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
• Potatoes:
    • Scrub
    • Cut lengthwise into quarters
  • Onion:
    • Peel
    • Cut into quarters

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
1. Food processor with grating disc
    1. Add potatoes
    2. Add onion
  2. Transfer to dishtowel
  3. Bowl
    1. Squeeze out liquid into bowl, let settle
    2. Pour off liquid, leaving potato starch
  4. Add, mix until absorbed
    • Eggs (2)
    • Flour (.5)
    • salt (2tsp)
    • pepper (.5tsp)
    • baking powder (1tsp)
  5. Shape into patties - press out with tablespoon
  6. Skillet
    1. Heat oil, .25in
    2. Add batter, flatten
    3. Cook until browned, 5min each side
    4. Sprinkle with salt

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Suggested Time: 45m
  • Servings: 36 patties, 12 servings

docs.title: Citation
docs.text: Inspired by: NYT

docs.title: Shopping
docs.text:
• Produce
    • garlic (4)
    • yellow onions (2)
    • green onions (.5c)
    • parsley (.5c)
  • Dairy
    • plain yogurt
  • Middle
    • brown basmati rice (1c)
    • brown lentils (1c)
  • Staples
    • bay leaves (2)
    • cumin (1tbsp)
    • salt (1.75tsp)
    • pepper
    • olive oil (.33c)
    • spicy sauce (opt): e.g., shatta, zhoug, sriracha

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
• Big Pot:
    • Garlic (4) whole
    • Bay leaves (2)
    • Cumin (1tbsp)
    • Salt (1.5tsp)
    • pepper
    • Water (5c)
  • Measure rice (1c)
  • Mearure lentils (1c)
  • Slice onions (2)
  • Slice garnish
    • green onions (.5c)
    • parsley (.5c)
  • Sides
    • Yogurt
    • Spicy sauce

docs.title: Cook
docs.text: Big pot for rice/lentils can be cooking while onions are caramelizing.

docs.title: Rice
docs.text:
1. Big pot to boil over med-high heat
    • Garlic (4) whole
    • Bay leaves (2)
    • Cumin (1tbsp)
    • Salt (1.5tsp)
    • pepper
    • Water (5c)
  2. After boil, add rice (1c), cover, and reduce to med heat (10m)
  3. Add lentils (1c), cover, and simmer (20-23m)
  4. Drain excess water, return to pot, and cover with towel (10m)
  5. Discard bay leaves
  6. Smash garlic against side of pot with fork
  7. Add half green onions and half parsley

docs.title: Onions
docs.text:
1. Separate 12in pan to medium-high heat until onion sizzles on contact
  2. Add
    • Olive oil (.33c)
    • Onions (2)
  3. Stir every 3m at first, then more often once edges start browning
  4. Cook until deeply caramelized and starting to crisp at edges (20-30m)
  5. Transfer to paper towel lined plate
  6. Sprinkle salt (0.25tsp)

docs.title: Serve
docs.text:
1. Combine rice/lentils and onions
  2. Garnish w/ remaining green onions and parsley
  3. Serve w/ yogurt and spicy sauce

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Suggested Time: 60m
    • Prep: 25m
    • Cook: 35m
  • Servings: 4

docs.title: Citation
docs.text: Inspired by: Cookie and Kate

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• Produce:
    • cherry tomatoes (2 c)
    • yellow squash (2 medium)
    • zucchini (1 medium)
    • fresh basil (1-2 tbsp)
    • lemon (1)
    • garlic (1)
  • Dairy:
    • butter (2 tbsp)
    • goat cheese (1 oz)
  • Middle:
    • whole grain pasta (.5 lb)
  • Staples:
    • olive oil (2 tbsp)
    • red pepper flakes
    • salt, pepper

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
1. Preheat oven to 400°F and line a baking sheet.
  2. Prepare vegetables on sheet
    • cherry tomatoes
    • yellow squash + zucchini - quartered lengthwise, .5in slices
  3. Bowl:
    • Chiffon basil (1-2 tbsp)
    • lemon juice (2 tbsp)
    • goat cheese (1 oz) crumbled
    • butter (2 tbsp)
    • red pepper flakes

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Veg:
    1. Toss tomatoes, squash, and zucc w/olive oil, salt, and pepper.
    2. Roast for 25m at 400°F.
  2. Pasta:
    1. Cook pasta until al dente. Reserve 1c pasta water.
    2. Drain pasta and return to the pot.
  3. Combine in pot:
    1. Add bowl w/ lemon juice, butter, goat cheese, etc.
    2. Add .25c pasta water - or more
    3. Add roasted veg and juices to the pot.
    4. Toss to combine.
    5. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with basil.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Suggested Time: 35m
    • Prep Time: 10m
    • Cook Time: 25m
  • Servings: 4

docs.title: Citation
docs.text: This recipe was inspired by Cookie and Kate.

docs.title: Shopping
docs.text:
• Produce
    • Sweet potatoes (2)
    • Kale (3–4c)
    • Avocado (1)
    • Apple (opt)
  • Dairy (none)
  • Middle
    • Tempeh blocks (2)
    • Sauerkraut (0.5c)
    • Dried cranberries (opt)
    • Quinoa (opt)
    • Crispy onions (opt)
    • Pecans (opt)
  • Staples
    • Maple syrup (0.25c)
    • Stone ground mustard (0.25c)
    • Soy sauce (2tbsp)
    • Olive oil (2tbsp)

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
1. Preheat the oven to 425.
  2. Mix dressing in big bowl
    • 0.25c maple syrup
    • 0.25c stone ground mustard
    • 2tbsp soy sauce
    • 2tbsp olive oil
  3. Open tempeh
    • drain liquid
    • marinate in half of dressing 30 min
  4. Prep veg
    • peel and dice sweet potatoes
    • cut kale into small pieces
    • cut optional apple into small pieces
  5. Set aside
    • 0.5c sauerkraut
    • 1 avocado
    • dried cranberries (opt)
    • quinoa (opt)
    • crispy onions (opt)
    • pecans (opt)

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
1. Baking sheet:
    • Tempeh
    • Sweet potatoes, with oil and salt
    • Roast 25–30 min
  2. Dressing bowl:
    • Kale into marination bowl
    • Add little more dressing and avocado
    • Massage
  3. Toss with other optional ingredients

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Suggested Time: 50m
  • Servings: 4-6

docs.title: Citation
docs.text: Inspired by: Pinch of Yum

docs.title: Salad
docs.text:
• Produce:
    • purple cabbage (2 c)
    • carrot (1)
    • snow/sugar snap peas (1 c)
    • green onion (.25 c)
    • lime (1)
    • ginger (1 tsp)
  • Staples:
    • quinoa or millet (.75 c)
    • peanuts, roasted and salted (.25 c)
    • smooth peanut butter (.25 c)
    • soy sauce (3 tbsp)
    • maple syrup or honey (1 tbsp)
    • rice vinegar (1 tbsp)
    • (toasted) sesame oil (1 tsp)
    • red pepper flakes

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
1. Cook .75c quinoa in a rice cooker w/1.5c water.
  2. Sauce. Wisk together (maybe nuke \<30s)
    • smooth peanut butter (.25 c)
    • soy sauce (3 tbsp)
    • maple syrup or honey (1 tbsp)
    • rice vinegar (1 tbsp)
    • (toasted) sesame oil (1 tsp)
    • lime juice (.5 lime)
    • red pepper flakes
  3. Thinly slice, bowl
    • purple cabbage (2 c)
    • carrot (1 c)
    • snow/sugar snap peas (1 c)
    • green onion (.25 c)
    • peanuts (.25 c)

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Cool cooked quinoa
  2. Combine

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Suggested Time: 40m
    • Prep Time: 20m
    • Cook Time: 20m
  • Servings: 4

docs.title: Citation
docs.text: This recipe was inspired by Cookie and Kate.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• Produce:
    • red onion (1 c)
    • red bell pepper (1)
    • broccoli (1 lb)
    • baby spinach (5 oz)
  • Middle:
    • tomato paste (2 tbsp)
    • vegetable broth (2 c)
    • black beans (15 oz)
    • 8 8" whole wheat tortillas
  • Dairy:
    • Monterey Jack cheese, shredded (1 c)
  • Staples:
    • olive oil (3 tbsp)
    • flour (3 tbsp)
    • ground chili powder (1 tbsp)
    • ground cumin (1 tsp)
    • garlic powder (0.5 tsp)
    • dried oregano (0.25 tsp)
    • salt/pepper
    • cinnamon, pinch (optional)
  • Staples:
    • olive oil (2 tbsp)
    • salt/pepper
    • cumin (1 tsp)
    • cinnamon (.25 tsp)

docs.title: Sauce
docs.text:
1. Measure sauce dry, small bowl.
    • flour (3 tbsp)
    • ground chili powder (1 tbsp)
    • ground cumin (1 tsp)
    • garlic powder (0.5 tsp)
    • dried oregano (0.25 tsp)
    • salt/pepper
  2. Measure? Sauce wet. Place near stove, separate.
    • tomato paste (2 tbsp)
    • vegetable broth (2 c)
    • apple cider vinegar (1 tsp)

docs.title: Enchilada
docs.text:
1. Preheat 400, middle rack
  2. Grease 9x13 pan, w/ tortillas nearby
  3. Chop red onion (1 c)
  4. Chop same bowl: broc florettes (1), red bell pepper (1)
  5. Small dry:
    • cumin (1 tsp)
    • cinnamon (.25 tsp)
  6. Measure 5c spinach packed
  7. Shred cheese (1 c)
  8. Mixing bowl
    • Drained black beans
    • Cheese (.25 c)

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Sauce:
    1. Warm oil in a pot over medium heat.
    2. Add flour/spices when sizzle on contact
    3. Whisk constantly for 1m until fragrant.
    4. Whisk in 2 tbsp tomato paste, then slowly pour in 2c broth.
    5. Heat to med-high, then gentle simmer 5-7m until thickened.
    6. Season salt/pepper
  2. Large skillet on medium w/ olive oil (2 tbsp)
    1. Cook onion 5-7m until translucent
    2. Add broc/bell pepper, 3-5m until tender
    3. Recuce to medium-low, cover, stir 8-9m until brown edges
    4. Add cumin/cinnamon, cook 30s
    5. Add spinach by handful, stir until wilted
    6. To bowl w/ beans/cheese
  3. Bowl: 2 tbsp sauce, stir
  4. Pan: 0.5 c sauce
  5. Assemble:
    1. Fill tortilla w/ .5c veg, roll, and place seam side down
    2. Drizzle remaining sauce/cheese.
  6. Bake 20 min mid rack
  7. Bake 3-6 min upper rack
  8. Rest 10 min

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Sauce:
    • Prep Time: 3m
    • Cook Time: 7m
    • Total Time: 10m
    • Yield: 2 c
  • Enchiladas:
    • Prep Time: 15m
    • Cook Time: 30m
    • Total Time: 45m
    • Yield: 4 servings
  • Total time: 60m

docs.title: Citation
docs.text: This recipe was inspired by Cookie and Kate's Enchilada Sauce and Vegetarian Enchiladas.

docs.title: Shopping
docs.text:
• Produce
    • lemon juice (2tbsp)
    • chopped parsley (2tbsp)
  • Dairy
  • Middle
  • Staples
    • tahini (.25c)
    • olive oil (.33c)
    • salt (.75tsp)
    • ground cumin (.25tsp)
    • smoked paprika (pinch)

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
• Press garlic (2)
  • Juice lemon (2tbsp)
  • Chop parsley (2tbsp)
  • Preheat oven to 450F with rack in upper third
  • Halve eggplants, bruch with olive oil, cut side down on sheet

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
1. Bake eggplant until tender, 35-40m
  2. Set aside to cool
  3. Flip, scoop out flesh, discard skin
  4. Mesh strainer over bowl, transfer flesh, discard skin
  5. Let rest, shake/stir to release moisture
  6. Discard liquid, wipe out
  7. Dump eggplant into food processor
  8. Add
    • tahini (.25c)
    • Garlic (2)
    • Lemon juice (2tbsp)
  9. Slow drizzle in olive oil (.33c)
  10. Stir in
    • Parsley (2tbsp)
    • salt (.75tsp)
    • ground cumin (.25tsp)

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Suggested Time: 55m
    • Prep: 20m
    • Cook: 35m
  • Servings: 6

docs.title: Citation
docs.text: Inspired by: Cookie and Kate

docs.title: Shopping
docs.text:
• Produce
    • Lemon (1)
    • Garlic (4)
  • Dairy
  • Middle
    • nuts (1 c)
  • Staples
    • Grapeseed oil (.25 c)
    • Nutritional yeast (.25 c)
    • Liquid aminos (1 tbsp)

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
NOTE: Pre-soak nuts >2h

  1. Soak 1c nuts
  2. Peel 4 garlic
  3. Measure
    • Grapeseed Oil .25c
    • Nutritional yeast .25c
    • Lemon juice .25c + .5 tbsp
    • Liquid aminos 1tbsp
  4. Spice mix
    • Salt 1 tsp
    • Garlic powder .5 tsp
    • Cumin .5 tsp
    • Cayenne dash

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
1. All ingredients to blender
  2. Airtight container overnight

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Suggested Time: 10m
    • Prep: 10m
    • Cook: 0m
  • Servings: 8
  • Substitutions:
    • Almonds -> Cashews don't need soaking

docs.title: Citation
docs.text: Inspired by: Blissful Basil

docs.title: Shopping
docs.text:
• Produce
    • Blueberries (1 c)
  • Dairy
    • Plain Yog (1 c)
    • Eggs (2)
  • Middle
  • Staples
    • Flour (1.8 c)
    • Baking powder (1 tsp)
    • Baking soda (.5 tsp)
    • Salt (.5 tsp)
    • Cinnamon (.25 tsp, opt)
    • Oil (.3 c)
    • Honey or maple syrup (.5 c)
    • Vanilla extract (2 tsp)
    • Sugar (1 tbsp)
    • Butter

docs.title: Prep
docs.text:
NOTE: Let eggs to room temp

  1. Grease muffin tin w/butter
  2. Beat 2 eggs
  3. Dry 1:
    • Flour 1.75 c
    • Baking powder (1 tsp)
    • Baking soda (.5 tsp)
    • Salt (.5 tsp)
    • Cinnamon (.25 tsp, opt)
  4. Dry 2:
    • Blueberries
    • 1 tsp flour
  5. Wet 1:
    • Oil (.3 c)
    • Honey or maple syrup (.5 c)
  6. Wet 2:
    • Plain Yog (1 c)
    • Vanilla extract (2 tsp)

docs.title: Cook
docs.text:
1. Oven to 400
  2. Bowl of oil, honey/maple
    1. Beat in eggs
    2. Add yogurt/vanilla
    3. Mix well
  3. Pour wet in dry
  4. Fold in blueberries
  5. Bake 16-19m

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Suggested Time: 35m
    • Prep: 13m
    • Cook: 22m
  • Servings: 12

docs.title: Citation
docs.text: Inspired by: Cookie and Kate
